title: Closest Point Finder
description: Interactive simulation demonstrating how to find the minimum distance from a fixed point to various curves. Shows that at the closest point, the connecting line is perpendicular to the tangent line, connecting optimization concepts to geometric reasoning.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Optimization
Distance Minimization
Perpendicularity
Derivatives
Tangent Lines

controls.name: Target Point
controls.description: Red target point that can be dragged anywhere on the coordinate plane

controls.name: Parameter Slider
controls.description: Controls the position of the green point along the selected curve

controls.name: Find Minimum
controls.description: Automatically locates the closest point on the curve to the target

controls.name: Curve Selector
controls.description: Select from parabola, cubic, circle, or sine curve

controls.name: Show Perpendicular
controls.description: Displays tangent line and slope calculations to verify perpendicularity at minimum
